results.title: SQLite Storage | Spin Docs
results.summary: Spin provides an interface for you to persist data in an SQLite Database managed by Spin, allowing developers to maintain relational data across application invocations.

results.title: Granting SQLite Database Permissions to Components
results.summary: This section explains how to grant access to SQLite databases for specific components in a Spin application, ensuring that only authorized components can access the database.

results.title: Using SQLite Storage From Applications
results.summary: Learn how to utilize the Spin SQLite Database interface in your applications, including common operations like opening a database and executing SQL statements.

results.title: Preparing an SQLite Database
results.summary: This section covers how to create and prepare SQLite tables using Spin, including running SQL scripts and commands during application startup.

results.title: Custom SQLite Databases
results.summary: Explore how to define custom SQLite databases in Spin, including changing the backing storage for the default database and granting access to components.

results.title: Granting Access to Custom SQLite Databases
results.summary: Understand how to grant access to custom SQLite databases for different components in a Spin application, ensuring proper access control.

results.title: Adding Variables to Your Applications
results.summary: This section explains how to add dynamic variables to a Spin application manifest, allowing for runtime configuration and easier management of secrets and API endpoints.

results.title: Using Variables From Applications
results.summary: Learn how to access and use application variables within your Spin applications using the Spin SDK across different programming languages.

results.title: Providing Variable Values
results.summary: This section covers how to provide values for application variables from various sources, including secrets stores and environment variables.

results.title: Troubleshooting
results.summary: Find solutions to common errors related to application variables in Spin, including provider resolution issues and undefined variables.

results.title: Writing Spin Applications | Spin Docs
results.summary: This page describes how to write components, manifests, and applications for Spin, a framework for building WebAssembly applications. It covers creating application manifests, writing component Wasm modules, and managing dependencies.

results.title: Writing Spin Applications | Spin Docs
results.summary: This page provides a comprehensive guide on how to write Spin applications, including creating manifests, components, and utilizing various features of the Spin framework.

results.title: SuperCollider
results.summary: A platform for audio synthesis and algorithmic composition, used by musicians, artists, and researchers working with sound. It features a real-time audio engine, an interpreted programming language, and an integrated editor.

results.title: Aphex Twin - Artists - WARP
results.summary: Richard D. James, known as Aphex Twin, is a celebrated and influential electronic artist with a vast discography and numerous aliases. His work spans decades, showcasing a unique blend of experimental sounds and innovative production techniques.

results.title: Autechre - Artists - WARP
results.summary: Autechre is an electronic music duo consisting of Rob Brown and Sean Booth, known for their innovative sound and complex compositions.

results.title: Aphex Twin - Artists - WARP
results.summary: Aphex Twin, the alias of Richard D. James, is a pioneering figure in electronic music, celebrated for his eclectic style and innovative production techniques.
